q: he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his ''adult supervision'' and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company. We have been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, said Eric Schmidt in announcing the decision. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of ''Googled: The End of the World As We Know It.'' ''I think Eric Schmidt is burned out.''
